content.question: A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity v at time t ≥ 0 is given by v(t) = sin(t2). The graph of v is shown above for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <msqrt> <mrow> <mn>5</mn> <mi>π</mi> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DE7@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. The position of the particle at time t is x(t) and its position at time t = 0 is x(0) = 5. (a) Find the acceleration of the particle at time t = 3.

frqParts.text: A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity v at time t ≥ 0 is given by v(t) = sin(t2). The graph of v is shown above for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <msqrt> <mrow> <mn>5</mn> <mi>π</mi> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DE7@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. The position of the particle at time t is x(t) and its position at time t = 0 is x(0) = 5. (a) Find the acceleration of the particle at time t = 3.
(b) Find the total distance traveled by the particle from time t = 0 to t = 3.
(c) Find the position of the particle at time t = 3.

(d) For <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><msqrt> <mrow> <mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DE7@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, find the time t at which the particle is farthest to the right. Explain your answer.

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
